title: Workflow Admin Application
content: The Workflow Admin Application is a comprehensive tool that allows organization administrators to create custom workflows for processing member submissions. The application provides all the functionality necessary to create linear sequences that enable organizational growth and provide transparency and clarity throughout the lifecycle of the workflow, from submission through to completion.

images.caption: Ideation and Sketching: In most projects, I like to start with brainstorming and sketching. Here I have used a variety of methods including whiteboarding, sticky notes, and marker sketching. Workshopping requirements with clients and stakeholders often yields important project insights, surfaces conflicting business needs, and can help solve user pain points before you even commit to a design.

Structured Planning: As a project moves through the requirements and discovery phase I like to transition from free-form exploratory activities to more structured planning and design activities. My go-to is the User Story Map. I find that the process of identifying epics, personas, and users stories as a team is an invaluable process for collaborative design.

Prototyping: Prior to investing time on pixel perfect mockups, I like to use low-fidelity interactive prototypes. Depending on the project I will use html/css interactive wireframes or tools like Balsamiq or Sketch for lower fidelity mockups. Low fidelity approaches allow faster iteration and testing of new ideas.

Advanced Customization: One of the main challenges to the development process was nailing down the requirements of each step in the workflow. To ensure a robust and extensible application, I had to avoid forcing an overly prescriptive data model. Each step needed to be designed so that it could be configured with unique sets of required information. Rather than building individual editing experiences for each type of step, I crafted custom a wizard tool that allowed powerful and complex configuration and is infinitely extensible (shown in the screenshot).
